alert.note: Alert for Randolph (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 14 at 7:49PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall from earlier storms is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following county, Randolph. The Tygart River Valley and Mill Creek are expected to go into flood. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 745 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. The Tygart River Valley and Mill Creek are expected to go into flood. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mill Creek and Huttonsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
